Rule: Higher education levels, such as a Master's degree or professional school degree, significantly increase the likelihood of earning more than $50k a year.
Marital status can influence the prediction. Being 'Separated' instead of 'Single' seems to be associated with a higher likelihood of earning more than $50k.
Occupation type can influence income predictions. Working in 'Sales' rather than a Blue-Collar job can contribute to a higher predicted income.
